item.description:
This hike makes a wide loop through Rocky Woods in Medfield, which is a property of The Trustees of Reservations. It visits three ponds, travels through pleasant woods, and reaches a hilltop outlook.  Cumulative gain is only 550, so if you've been looking for a hike to kick-start yourself into Spring, this is it!

I am a "slow and steady hiker" (tortoise-like in my determination) and I plan these hikes for people like me!  So if you are worried about not being able to keep up, or if you haven't hiked in a while or even if you just want a nice, pleasant and slower hike on an early spring day - this one is for you!

Description of the hike with a map is here:
http://www.hikenewengland.com/RockyWoodsMA080602.html

Read about Rocky Woods here:
http://www.thetrustees.org/places-to-visit/greater-boston/rocky-woods.html

 

The distance will be about 4 - 5 miles, time will be about 3 - 4 hours.  If it's a nice day, we'll stop mid-way for lunch!

NOTE: Even though this is an "easy" hike, please be prepared for changing weather conditions and plan accordingly.  Bring at least 2 liters of water, some high-energy snacks, an extra jacket and dress in layers.  Wear wool socks and NO cotton!  You will want a hat and gloves and if there's still considerable snow on the ground, maybe even snowshoes!  (Hard to believe right now that there will come a time with NO snow on the ground!)

Directions

Hartford Street
Medfield, MA 02052
Telephone: 508.785.0339
E-mail: charlesrivervalley@ttor.org

Latitude: 42.207000

Longitude: -71.276615

From I-95/Rt. 128 (Exit 16B): Rt. 109 West for 5.7 mi. Turn right onto Hartford St. and follow for 0.6 mi. to entrance and parking (100 cars) on left.

From Intersection of Rts. 27 and 109 (Medfield): Take Rt. 109 East and bear left onto Hartford St. Continue as above.
item.name: Easy early Spring Hike in Rocky Woods!
